I will redesign the 'Class Countdown' website with a modern, professional, and user-friendly interface. The project will be built using only HTML, CSS, and vanilla JavaScript, with Tailwind CSS for styling and Day.js for robust date/time manipulation. I will create a multi-page structure for better organization: a main dashboard (index.html) showing the live countdown, current alerts, and a summary of the upcoming schedule, and a dedicated full schedule page (schedule.html). The design will feature a clean layout, a fresh color palette (deep blues and vibrant accents), improved typography via Google Fonts, and a responsive, mobile-first approach. JavaScript will be modularized into separate files for handling the countdown logic, managing schedule data, and controlling UI interactions like a theme toggle (light/dark mode). This structure ensures the final product is not only visually appealing but also maintainable and scalable.

I will create a complete, multi-page redesign of the 'Class Countdown' website. The new design will be modern, clean, and fully responsive, built with vanilla HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, and styled using Tailwind CSS. The project will be structured into multiple files for better organization and maintainability. The main page (index.html) will feature a dynamic countdown timer, a weather widget powered by the OpenWeatherMap API, a 'Quote of the Day', and a summary of the day's schedule. I will also create dedicated pages for the full weekly schedule (schedule.html) and a new calendar view (calendar.html). JavaScript logic will be modularized to handle the countdown, schedule data, API calls, and UI updates separately. The design will include a light/dark mode theme switcher for improved user experience and will use Day.js for accurate time calculations.

I will create a complete, multi-page redesign of the 'Class Countdown' website, focusing on a modern, professional, and user-friendly interface with a red-centric color scheme. The project will be built using only vanilla HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, leveraging Tailwind CSS for styling, Day.js for robust date/time manipulation, and Font Awesome for icons. The structure will be modular and multi-file for maintainability. The main page (index.html) will serve as a dynamic dashboard featuring a live countdown timer, a weather widget for Mesa, AZ using the Open-Meteo API, a 'Quote of the Day', and a summary of the current day's schedule. A second page (schedule.html) will provide a comprehensive view of the full weekly bell schedules. The design will incorporate the requested RMHS logo, a fresh red-based color palette, improved typography via Google Fonts, and a responsive, mobile-first layout. The JavaScript will be organized into separate modules for handling the countdown logic, managing schedule data, fetching weather data, and controlling UI interactions, including a light/dark mode theme switcher. This approach ensures the final product is visually appealing, highly functional, and easy to manage.
